project.teaser: Science for Everyone has been perceived as a motto to involve the general public, especially young students, with research activities and scientific knowledge that may answer to concerns related to sustainability, climate neutrality and social inclusion, major world and...
project.objective:
Science for Everyone has been perceived as a motto to involve the general public, especially young students, with research activities and scientific knowledge that may answer to concerns related to sustainability, climate neutrality and social inclusion, major world and European challenges.
This proposal intends to directly respond to Responsible Research and Innovation (RRI) goals of the EU framework program by raising the public awareness, also among school communities, about the relevance of science to assure resources preservation, decarbonization and inclusion and by bridging the gap between scientists and society, giving researchers the opportunity to perceive the main concerns of citizens and how those see and understand their work. Schools and their students will be involved in activities during the whole project, in order to ensure the impact in such communities. Thus, by increasing public and students outreach, SCIEVER will contribute simultaneously for two main objectives: (i) improving the understanding of the importance of scientific careers development and science investments; (ii) increasing researchers' understanding of the role of society as a whole for sustainable science policies development.
The consortium of this project is coordinated by the University of Lisbon through the National Museum of Natural History and Science and combines efforts between researchers of major universities in Portugal, including four urban areas from north to south the University of Minho, the International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory, the University of vora, the University of Coimbra and the Lisbon University Institute for the impact assessment. Nova University in Lisbon will coordinate a special program targeting school communities and the Superior School for Tourism in Estoril will contribute to disseminate food security practices. The Lisbon municipality is a central partner for the engagement of diverse audiences and civil society stakeholders.
project.title: Science for Everyone - Sustainability and Inclusion
project.keywords: Scientists, society and school communities, carbon neutrality, resources preservation, social inclusion, sustainability

result.title: D8 Researchers at School report ERN23
result.description: D8 (month 19, final report) will include the list of activities developed within the national school program (online and onsite) and regional activities, including description of resources and outputs, as well as numbers of participants – students, teachers, researchers. Both deliverables will also highlight EU projects disseminated within the program.

result.title: D5 Management report
result.description: D5 is the Periodic management report Month 9

result.title: D3 Researchers at School report
result.description: D3 month 9 periodic report will include the list of activities developed within the national school program online and onsite and regional activities including description of resources and outputs as well as numbers of participants students teachers researchers Both deliverables will also highlight EU projects disseminated within the program

result.title: D10 Management report ERN23
result.description: D10 is the Final management report (Month 21).

result.title: D6 Awareness Campaign Report ERN23
result.description: There will be a reports on the awareness campaign D2 (month 20, periodic report), comprising indicators such as actions, media feedback, activities on Internet such as hits on website, number of Facebook shares and likes, number of YouTube channel views, and number of Instagram followers.One set of samples of promotional material (e.g. posters, leaflets, programs, postcards, flyers) will be produced along the above mentioned periodic reports.

result.title: D7 Activities during the NIGHT23
result.description: D7 (month 20, final report) will report on the build-up and Night’s activities that will include: the list of activities, the Night programmes, the number of participants, the success rate and possible lessons learnt including a list of Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellows involved in the event and an identical list of any other fellows funded under another Horizon 2020/Europe funding scheme.Pictures, videos and public written testimonies will accompany the report to be potentially used by the European Commission for promotional/communication purposes.

result.title: D4 Impact Assessment report
result.description: D4 is a periodic report in month9 on the impact assessment including samples tools used main trends and conclusions accompanied by samples of questionnairesinterviews in English

result.title: D9 Impact Assessment report ERN23
result.description: D9 is a periodic report in month 20 on the impact assessment (including samples, tools used, main trends and conclusions) accompanied by samples of questionnaires/interviews in English.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
